main event: Observations of unidentified aerial objects over Yaak, Montana in September 1952.
interesting points: The objects were first observed by radar and visually by three airmen,The objects appeared as bright lights with a range of colors and were reported to move rapidly in erratic patterns,The radar showed targets moving and stationary in the same area,The lights were described as emitting no noise and leaving vapor trails when they divided,The last light observed later appeared under an aircraft at a significantly lower altitude.
witness description: three airmen familiar with conventional aircraft
